substantial violations were found.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Samantha Way at 517-243-9743.

Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
***This report contains sexually explicit information***
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000334
Special Investigation Intake Date: January 27, 2025
License #: CI410201226
Licensee Group Organization: Wedgwood Christian Services
Licensee Designee: David Gorman
Chief Administrator: Jason Lheureux
Agency Name: KENTWOOD CAMPUS
Agency Address: 3290 36TH ST
GRAND RAPIDS, MI 49512-8193
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 03/01/2027
Capacity: 36

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description
(4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(b) Experience to perform the duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A staff member calls a youth "baby girl" all of the time. The staff
member also goes into the youth's room at night and touches the
youth's body in the chest area. If the youth screams, the staff
member covers her mouth.
Investigation Interviews:
School Social Worker was interviewed via phone on January
30, 2025. School Social Worker reported she was doing a check
in with Youth A and she reported the allegations to her. She
reported Youth A specifically stated the staff member’s name was
Jordan. School Social Worker reported she had no other
additional information otherwise provided in the allegations.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on
January 27, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. When
allegations were reviewed with Administrator 1, he reported there
is no staff by the name of Jordan that works at the facility. He
reported Youth A has been placed at the facility since the end of
September 2024 and since this time, there has been no staff with
the name of Jordan working at the facility. Administrator 1
reported only female staff work the overnight shift on Youth A’s
unit since it is an all-female unit.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the Children’s
Advocacy Center on January 31, 2025, in collaboration with
Law Enforcement and MDHHS Worker. Youth A reported she
does not feel safe at the facility at night because someone
continues to enter her room. She reported the person who was
coming into her room was a male staff member who goes by a
different name than was originally reported. Youth A reported Staff
1 would come into her room and touch her chest. She reported on
the second day of being placed at the facility, September 28,
2024, Staff 1 opened her bedroom door to allow her into the room.
2

Youth A reported Staff 1 followed her into the room and closed the
door. She reported he touched her breast under her shirt, and she
tried to push him away, but he was too strong. Youth A reported
he left about three minutes later and she cried in her room. She
reported there was a second time this occurred which was a few
days before Christmas. Youth A reported during that time she was
already in her room getting ready for bed and Staff 1 started to
touch her breast and traveled his hands on her thighs. She
reported that after he touched her, he left the room. Youth A
reported she tried to tell Staff 2 about the situation, but she did not
believe her. She reported she also believes she told Nurse, Youth
B and Youth C about these incidents as well. Youth A reported
those were the only two times this occurred. When asked to
describe Staff 1, she reported he is a tall, middle-aged, white
male, with brown hair, glasses, and a tattoo of a clock and his
name on his forearm. Youth A reported Staff 1 works the overnight
shifts on her unit and works every Friday, Saturday, and Tuesday
night. She reported Staff 1’s primary job is to make sure the youth
are safe in their bedrooms and complete nighttime bed checks.
Youth A reported the first night he assaulted her he was the only
night shift staff working and the second night he assaulted there
was someone else working but could not remember who that was.
When asked if there was anything else that was needed to know,
she reported the first time Staff 1 came into her room, he also
slammed her back on an object and it hurt which is why Nurse
knows about the situation. She denied being called any names
from staff. Youth A reported she was also feeling suicidal and
noted that she was hiding shoestrings and a knife in her room.
This consultant contacted Administrator 1 and Administrator 2
about these concerns. The facility planned to do a room search,
put Youth A on precautionary status, and immediately meet with
her therapist for an assessment.
Administrator 2 and Manager were interviewed together face
to face at the facility on February 4, 2025, in collaboration
with MDHHS Worker and Law Enforcement. Administrator 2
and Manager reported Administrator 1 is the only one with the
similar name of Staff 1 that works under this license. They both
reported Administrator 1 would not be on the unit for bed checks
and mainly goes onto the unit to do check ins with staff. Manager
reported there would be no fill-ins to come support the unit either
with the similar name of Staff 1.
Administrator 1 was reinterviewed face to face at the facility
on February 4, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and
Law Enforcement. Administrator 1 reported he has never had
3

interactions with Youth A. He reported that the only time he is on
the unit is when he checks in with Supervisor and the staff on the
unit. Administrator 1 denied ever doing bedroom checks and
reports he hardly goes into the youth bedroom hallways. The only
time he goes into the youth’s bedroom hallway is when this
licensing consultant comes to do an unannounced visit.
Administrator 1 reported that he tries to not go on Youth A’s unit a
lot because this is an all-female unit where many of them have
trauma that involves a male traumatizing them and he wants to
respect that boundary. He reported he teaches the professional
boundary training at the facility for all staff and notes the
importance of maintaining appropriate boundaries. Administrator 1
denied ever touching anyone inappropriately or ever going into a
youth’s bedroom. He reported that he does have a tattoo on his
arm, which is of a pirate ship on the shoulder of his arm.
Nurse was interviewed face to face at the facility on February
4, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Law
Enforcement. Nurse reported she has met with Youth A about
once a week since she arrived at the facility. She reported she has
seen Youth A due to reports of not feeling well or due to Youth A
reporting she has swallowed something to harm herself. Nurse
reported Youth A has reported she has swallowed items that she
does not have access to and only has swallowed a screw once
from the wall with the intention to harm herself. She reported
Youth A went out for medical treatment for this incident. Nurse
reported Youth A has never disclosed any concerns of sexual or
physical abuse to her. She reported she has never seen
Administrator 1 have direct interaction with Youth A.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on
February 4, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker and
Law Enforcement. Supervisor reported Youth A has never
disclosed any sexual or physical abuse that involved a staff
member to her. She reported Youth A has talked about her past
trauma history with her family which included concerns of sexual
and physical abuse. Supervisor reported there is no Jordan that
works at the facility and the only staff member with a similar name
to Staff 1 is Administrator 1. She reported Administrator 1 only
comes to the unit every couple of days for less than five minutes
and that is to just check in with herself and other staff. Supervisor
reported she has never seen Administrator 1 ever have any
interactions with Youth A and does not complete room checks at
the facility. She reported that the male staff on the unit are
directed not to do room checks on the unit, unless necessary, due
to it being an all-female unit for the safety of both staff and the
4

youth. Supervisor reported staff never go into bedrooms for room
unchecks unless they cannot see the youth physically or don’t see
their body moving or breathing. She reported staff looked into the
window of the room and shine a light in to check on the unit. There
were no reported concerns of staff calling youth inappropriate
names.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on February 4, 2025, in
collaboration with MDHHS Worker and Law Enforcement.
Staff 2 reported she has worked the overnight shift on the unit for
over the past 20 years. She reported she works 11pm-7am and
her main role is to make sure the youth are safe throughout the
night. Staff 2 reported she completes bed checks by looking in the
window of the youth’s door, shining a flashlight, and making sure
to see the body and breath of the youth. She reported she had
opened the youth’s bedroom door when she could not see them,
but she tried to stand in the doorway and never closed the door
behind her. Staff 2 reported she is very familiar with Youth A and
talks to her often. She reported Youth A has never disclosed of
any staff inappropriately touching her or calling her names. Staff 2
denied any staff named Jordan working at the facility and the only
staff with the similar name to Staff 1 is Administrator 1. She
reported she does not see Administrator 1 ever on the unit. When
asked if there is anything else that should be known about Youth
A, Staff 2 reported Youth A is not always fluid with the truth such
as she will lie about taking a shower.
Youth B and Youth C were interviewed separately face to face
at the facility on February 4, 2025, in collaboration with
MDHHS Worker. Youth B and Youth C reported feeling safe at
the facility. They both denied any boundary concerns with any of
the staff or hearing of a youth ever being touched inappropriately
by a staff member. There was no disclosure of concerns about
staff calling youth inappropriate names. Youth B and Youth C
denied any staff working on their unit named Jordan. When asked
about the name of Staff 1 they reported the only person they see
with that name is Administrator 1. Youth B and Youth C denied
Administrator 1 ever being on the unit during bedtime or doing bed
checks. They both have only seen Administrator 1 come to the
unit to talk to Supervisor and other staff members for a brief period
during the daytime. Youth B and Youth C denied any boundary
concerns with Administrator 1 or any other male staff at the unit.
Law Enforcement was interviewed face to face at the facility
February 4, 2025, in collaboration with MDHHS Worker. Law
Enforcement reported they do not have enough evidence to
5

support any charges being pressed and will be closing out their
case.
Documents Reviewed:
- Facility Staff List September 2024 to January 2025-
Administrator 1 is the only staff member at the facility with the
same first name as Staff 1. There is no staff member by the
name of Jordan.
- Human Resource File for Administrator 1- Administrator 1
has no disciplinary action noted within his human resource
file. He is up to date on all his required trainings, including
Professional Boundaries training on November 11, 2024.
- Facility Suitable Treatment and Freedom of Movement
Treatment Procedure with the most recent update dated
June 20, 2024- This policy notes Staff are to address clients
in a respectful manner, using the name and pronouns
which the client has identified. The document notes,
“Employee involved in inappropriate touching, physical sex,
talking about sexual acts, or sharing suggestive materials
that are of sexual nature is strictly prohibited. Employees
found to have been involved in any of these actives above
will be terminated immediately and prosecuted to the fullest
extent of the law.”
- Card Access to Riebel Unit dated 09/27/2024 to
09/28/2024- Administrator 1 did no badge into the unit
during this time period. There was no named Jordan or any
staff with similar name to Staff 1.
- Card Access to Riebel Unit dated 12/20/2024 to
12/25/2024- Administrator 1 badged into the unit on
12/21/2024 at 11:45:32am and badged out at 11:51:14am.
Administrator 1 badged into the unit on 12/24/2024 at
10:54:57am and badged out at 10:55:58am. Administrator
1 badged into the unit on 12/25/2024 at 11:07:26am and
badged out at 11:08:43am. There was no named Jordan or
any staff with similar name to Staff 1.
- Youth A’s Individual Program Modification dated
10/28/2024- Due to Youth A’s self-harm and unsafe
behavior, she will remain in a stripped room with only her
bedding and one stuffed animal and one book of her
choosing, to prevent Youth A to gain access to items that
could harm her. When Youth A leaves the unit, she is
required to have one to one staffing.
- Youth A’s Behavior plan dated 10/10/2024- Due to Youth
A’s history of swallowing foreign objects staff are to: follow
protocol for suicide precautions; engage in proper and
frequent person checks during all transition; follow proper
well documented checks for observations when client is out
6

of staff eyesight; monito spaces and check bathrooms prior
to use for loose foreign objects that could be ingested when
able; get to know the client, providing positive attention
when able to get to know the client and build report.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance with this rule. Youth A first
identified the name of the person assaulting her was Jordan and it
was found that no one by that name has worked at the facility
during the time Youth A was placed there. Youth A then reported
in her interview the staff name was a different name and the only
person that has a similar name is Administrator 1. Within the
interview with Administrator 1 and other staff members,
Administrator 1 has limited contact with youth at the facility and
only goes on the units to check in with staff members. From
reviewing the badging of the key card into the unit, Administrator 1
was never on the unit during the time Youth A reported the
incidents occurred or near bedtime. Administrator 1 also did not
have the same tattoo that Youth A described the alleged staff
member had.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
March 3, 2025
